comments.body:
Just like this may be ok .  @juliuszsompolski 
If removed we don't need to do anything

but I think this
```
    val view = kvstore.view(classOf[ExecutionInfo]).index("finishTime").first(0L)
    val toDelete = KVUtils.viewToSeq(view, countToDelete.toInt) { j =>
      j.finishTimestamp != 0
    }
```
can still delete executions that are FINISHED, but still fetching?

> can still delete executions that are FINISHED, but still fetching?

https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/d38f8167483d4d79e8360f24a8c0bffd51460659/sql/hive-thriftserver/src/main/scala/org/apache/spark/sql/hive/thriftserver/ui/HiveThriftServer2AppStatusStore.scala#L113-L123

Here will control this. Won't remove `FINISHED` execution.
I think we can add a comment here to explain? This issue can happen only on cancel operations right?

> I think we can add a comment here to explain? This issue can happen only on cancel operations right?

Some operation `FAILED|CANCELED` and remove statementId before call `closeOperation `
in current master brach.

Yeah, we could add comment like `Operations that were CANCELED or FAILED may have already been removed.`

But now it doesn't happen because we don't trim LiveExecutionData?
Yes, It seems this issue doesn't happen as we aren't removing `LiveExecutionData`.  @AngersZhuuuu Could you make `spark.sql.thriftserver.ui.retainedStatements=1` and try to reproduce the same?

> Yes, It seems this issue doesn't happen as we aren't removing `LiveExecutionData`. @AngersZhuuuu Could you make `spark.sql.thriftserver.ui.retainedStatements=1` and try to reproduce the same?

So complicated now... executionList won't remove, and then `updateStoreWithTriggerEnabled ` may cause some problem.  I will test it .
I don't think, `updateStoreWithTriggerEnabled` cause a problem, as it write a new entry to the kvstore, like in the historyserver case.

> I don't think, `updateStoreWithTriggerEnabled` cause a problem, as it write a new entry to the kvstore, like in the historyserver case.

seems we don't need to fix this now.

> seems we don't need to fix this now.

Yes, Right. But still in branch-2.4 this issue can happen right?

> > seems we don't need to fix this now.
> 
> Yes, Right. But still in branch-2.4 this issue can happen right?

Don't need, since i spark-2.4, didn't add `onStatementClosed & onStatementCanceled`
